meanings.definition: A type of baryon that is heavier than a neutron or proton.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study hyperons to learn more about their properties.
meanings.sent2: The hyperons in the nucleus play a crucial role in nuclear interactions.
meanings.sent3: Why did the hyperons go to the party? Because they wanted to have a 'heavy' good time!
meanings.sent4: In the world of subatomic particles, hyperons stand out like giants among dwarfs.
meanings.sent5: The hyperons, with their extra weight, are like the heavyweight champions of the baryon world.

meanings.definition: Particles that are composed of three quarks, including strange quarks.
meanings.sent1: The hyperons exhibit unique behavior due to their composition of three quarks.
meanings.sent2: Strange quarks give hyperons their distinct properties compared to other particles.
meanings.sent3: Why did the hyperons start a band? Because they wanted to create 'strange' music!
meanings.sent4: In the symphony of subatomic particles, hyperons play the role of the intriguing soloists.
meanings.sent5: The hyperons, with their trio of quarks, dance together in a subatomic waltz.
